Activity: Check emails and respond to any urgent requests or questions related to yesterday's work.
Browse the web for the latest data visualization tools and techniques. Looking for inspiration on how to present the data quality reports effectively.
Meet with @dba-1 to discuss data extraction strategy and access the EHR database to start data extraction work. Focus on querying the database for the key data elements identified yesterday.
Write SQL queries to extract relevant data from the EHR database (ICD-10 codes, lab results, vaccination records, demographic data). Validate the queries to ensure they return accurate results.
Lunch break. Grab a quick lunch with colleagues.

Continue extracting and cleaning the data, transforming it into a format suitable for analysis. Address any data quality issues identified during the extraction process (e.g., missing values, inconsistent formatting).
Start working on setting weekly targets for improvement for each data quality metric. Consider the current baseline levels and set realistic, achievable goals for each metric.
Send an email to @qatest-1, @qatest-2 about data sample and request data validation support. Provide a sample of the extracted data and the defined data quality metrics for review.
Document the weekly targets for improvement in a shared document, including the rationale behind each target.
Wrap up for the day. Review the progress and plan for tomorrow.
